writeAttributes

                                   Map<String,Object> attributes)
                            throws IOException
Writes out attributes contained in the Map<attributeName, attributeValue>. If map is null, writes nothing.

Throws:
IOException

writeAttributesForced

public static void writeAttributesForced(Writer out,
                                         Map<String,Object> attributes)
                                  throws IOException
Writes out attributes contained in the Map<attributeName, attributeValue>. If map is null, writes nothing. Uses writeAttributeForced(Writer, String, Object) to write out each attribute, meaning that empty attributes will be written out as well.

Parameters:
out - The writer where to write.
attributes - A map of attributes, where keys will be treated as attribute values, to write. May be null .
Throws:
IOException - Any exception related to writing to the given writer.
Since:
2.0

writeAttribute

public static void writeAttribute(Writer out,
                                  String name,
                                  Object value)
                           throws IOException
Throws:
IOException

writeAttributeForced

public static void writeAttributeForced(Writer out,
                                        String name,
                                        Object value)
                                 throws IOException
Writes attribute of form ' name"value"'. When value is null or empty, the attribute value will be rendered as an empty String. The value will also be HTML-escaped.

Parameters:
out - The writer where the text should be written.
name - The name for the attribute.
value - The value for the attribute. Will be translated into String using toString() method. null will be translated into an empty string.
Throws:
IOException - Any exception related to writing.
Since:
2.0
See Also:
writeAttribute(Writer, String, Object, boolean, boolean)

writeAttribute

public static void writeAttribute(Writer out,
                                  String name,
                                  Object value,
                                  boolean escape)
                           throws IOException
Writers attribute of form ' name"value"'. If the name or value is empty, writes nothing. If escape is set to true, HTML escaping takes place on the value (<, >, ", & get replaced with the entities).

Parameters:
out - The writer where the text should be written.
name - The name for the attribute.
value - The value for the attribute. Will be translated into String using toString() method. null will be translated into an empty string.
escape - A boolean indicating whether the value should be HTML-escaped before writing.
Throws:
IOException - Any exception related to writing.

writeAttribute

public static void writeAttribute(Writer out,
                                  String name,
                                  Object value,
                                  boolean escape,
                                  boolean force)
                           throws IOException
Writers attribute of form ' name"value"'. If the name or value is empty, writing will depend on the force parameter. If escape is set to true, HTML escaping takes place on the value (<, >, ", & get replaced with the entities).

Parameters:
out - The writer where the text should be written.
name - The name for the attribute.
value - The value for the attribute. Will be translated into String using toString() method. null will be translated into an empty string.
escape - A boolean indicating whether the value should be HTML-escaped before writing.
force - A boolean indicating whether the value should written even when name/value is empty.
Throws:
IOException - Any exception related to writing.
Since:
2.0

                                     String value,
                                     boolean escapeEntities)
                              throws IOException

Parameters:
escapeEntities - set it to true if you want to escape XML entities like &amp;, <lt; etc.
Throws:
IOException
See Also:

expression - expression

                         throws IOException

IOException

writeEscapedScriptString

public static void writeEscapedScriptString(Writer out,
                                            String value,
                                            boolean escapeEntities)
Writes out escaped script string (can be used also in attributes). null values are omitted. When escapeEntities is true, standard XML entities are escaped from greater-than, less-than, ampersand and double-quotes symbols. Otherwise, these symbols are left as they are. Set escapeEntities to true, if you write javascript inside an attribute, and set it to false if you write javascript inside a <script> tag.

Parameters:
escapeEntities - Whether entities in value should be escaped.

IOException

IOException

parseMultiValuedAttribute

public static List<String> parseMultiValuedAttribute(String attribute)
Parses multi-valued attribute, where attributes are separated by commas. Empty attribute values are allowed, they are specified by including whitespace between commas: "first, ,third".

Parameters:
attribute - The regions attribute containing multiple values separated commas.
Returns:
List<String> containing attribute values.
